definition: to hold the rudder/to hold (to take, to be at) the helm/to steer
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful

sentences.english: Commodore, he's disabled the rudder chain, sir.
sentences.chinese: 准將，他把舵鏈鬆開了，先生。

sentences.english: Do not fear the helm, the boat secure.
sentences.chinese: 把舵的不慌，乘船的穩當。

sentences.english: When knowledge hoists the sails, let reason steer the wheel.
sentences.chinese: 學問如風送帆動，還得明理好把舵。

sentences.english: He steered the boat toward land.
sentences.chinese: 他把舵將小船開往陸地。

sentences.english: Let me steer the ship now and you trim your sails to the wind.
sentences.chinese: 現在讓我來把舵，你只要從旁邊助我一臂就行。

definition: to scull (with a single oar, usually mounted on the stern of the boat)
to steer (a vessel)/to hold the rudder/at the helm
the bow or prow of a ship
